verses.verse: In the third<WH7969> year<WH8141> of the reign<WH4438> of king<WH4428> Belshazzar<WH1112> a vision<WH2377> appeared<WH7200> unto me, even unto me Daniel<WH1840>, after<WH310> that which appeared<WH7200> unto me at the first<WH8462>.

And I saw<WH7200> in a vision<WH2377>; and it came to pass, when I saw<WH7200>, that I was at Shushan<WH7800> in the palace<WH1002>, which is in the province<WH4082> of Elam<WH5867>; and I saw<WH7200> in a vision<WH2377>, and I was by the river<WH180> of Ulai<WH195>.

Then I lifted up<WH5375> mine eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200>, and, behold, there stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> the river<WH180> a<WH259> ram<WH352> which had two horns<WH7161>: and the two horns<WH7161> were high<WH1364>; but one<WH259> was higher<WH1364> than the other<WH8145>, and the higher<WH1364> came up<WH5927> last<WH314>. the other: Heb. the second

I saw<WH7200> the ram<WH352> pushing<WH5055> westward<WH3220>, and northward<WH6828>, and southward<WH5045>; so that no beasts<WH2416> might stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> him, neither was there any that could deliver<WH5337> out of his hand<WH3027>; but he did<WH6213> according to his will<WH7522>, and became great<WH1431>.

And as I was considering<WH995>, behold, an he<WH5795> goat<WH6842> came<WH935> from the west<WH4628> on the face<WH6440> of the whole earth<WH776>, and touched<WH5060> not the ground<WH776>: and the goat<WH6842> had a notable<WH2380> horn<WH7161> between his eyes<WH5869>. touched: or, none touched him in the earth a notable: Heb. a horn of sight

And he came<WH935> to the ram<WH352> that had<WH1167> two horns<WH7161>, which I had seen<WH7200> standing<WH5975> before<WH6440> the river<WH180>, and ran<WH7323> unto him in the fury<WH2534> of his power<WH3581>.

And I saw<WH7200> him come<WH5060> close unto<WH681> the ram<WH352>, and he was moved with choler<WH4843> against him, and smote<WH5221> the ram<WH352>, and brake<WH7665> his two<WH8147> horns<WH7161>: and there was no power<WH3581> in the ram<WH352> to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> him, but he cast him down<WH7993> to the ground<WH776>, and stamped<WH7429> upon him: and there was none that could deliver<WH5337> the ram<WH352> out of his hand<WH3027>.

Therefore the he<WH6842> goat<WH5795> waxed very<WH3966> great<WH1431>: and when he was strong<WH6105>, the great<WH1419> horn<WH7161> was broken<WH7665>; and for it came up<WH5927> four<WH702> notable ones<WH2380> toward the four<WH702> winds<WH7307> of heaven<WH8064>.

And out of one<WH259> of them came forth<WH3318> a little<WH4704> horn<WH7161>, which waxed exceeding<WH3499> great<WH1431>, toward the south<WH5045>, and toward the east<WH4217>, and toward the pleasant<WH6643> land.

And it waxed great<WH1431>, even to the host<WH6635> of heaven<WH8064>; and it cast down<WH5307> some of the host<WH6635> and of the stars<WH3556> to the ground<WH776>, and stamped<WH7429> upon them. to the host: or, against the host

Yea, he magnified<WH1431> himself even to the prince<WH8269> of the host<WH6635>, and by him the daily<WH8548> sacrifice was taken away<WH7311> <WH7311>, and the place<WH4349> of his sanctuary<WH4720> was cast down<WH7993>. to: or, against by him: or, from him

And an host<WH6635> was given<WH5414> him against the daily<WH8548> sacrifice by reason of transgression<WH6588>, and it cast down<WH7993> the truth<WH571> to the ground<WH776>; and it practised<WH6213>, and prospered<WH6743>. an host: or, the host was given over for the transgression against the daily sacrifice

Then I heard<WH8085> one<WH259> saint<WH6918> speaking<WH1696>, and another<WH259> saint<WH6918> said<WH559> unto that certain<WH6422> saint which spake<WH1696>, How long shall be the vision<WH2377> concerning the daily<WH8548> sacrifice, and the transgression<WH6588> of desolation<WH8074>, to give<WH5414> both the sanctuary<WH6944> and the host<WH6635> to be trodden under foot<WH4823>? that: or, the numberer of secrets, or, the wonderful numberer: Heb. Palmoni of: or, making desolate

And he said<WH559> unto me, Unto two thousand<WH505> and three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> days<WH6153> <WH1242>; then shall the sanctuary<WH6944> be cleansed<WH6663>. days: Heb. evening morning cleansed: Heb. justified

And it came to pass, when I, even I Daniel<WH1840>, had seen<WH7200> the vision<WH2377>, and sought<WH1245> for the meaning<WH998>, then, behold, there stood<WH5975> before me as the appearance<WH4758> of a man<WH1397>.

And I heard<WH8085> a man's<WH120> voice<WH6963> between the banks of Ulai<WH195>, which called<WH7121>, and said<WH559>, Gabriel<WH1403>, make this<WH1975> man to understand<WH995> the vision<WH4758>.

So he came<WH935> near<WH681> where I stood<WH5977>: and when he came<WH935>, I was afraid<WH1204>, and fell<WH5307> upon my face<WH6440>: but he said<WH559> unto me, Understand<WH995>, O son<WH1121> of man<WH120>: for at the time<WH6256> of the end<WH7093> shall be the vision<WH2377>.

Now as he was speaking<WH1696> with me, I was in a deep sleep<WH7290> on my face<WH6440> toward the ground<WH776>: but he touched<WH5060> me, and set<WH5975> me upright<WH5977>. set: Heb. made me stand upon my standing
And he said<WH559>, Behold, I will make thee know<WH3045> what shall be in the last end<WH319> of the indignation<WH2195>: for at the time appointed<WH4150> the end<WH7093> shall be.
The ram<WH352> which thou sawest<WH7200> having<WH1167> two horns<WH7161> are the kings<WH4428> of Media<WH4074> and Persia<WH6539>.
And the rough<WH8163> goat<WH6842> is the king<WH4428> of Grecia<WH3120>: and the great<WH1419> horn<WH7161> that is between his eyes<WH5869> is the first<WH7223> king<WH4428>.
Now that being broken<WH7665>, whereas four<WH702> stood up<WH5975> for it, four<WH702> kingdoms<WH4438> shall stand up<WH5975> out of the nation<WH1471>, but not in his power<WH3581>.

And in the latter time<WH319> of their kingdom<WH4438>, when the transgressors<WH6586> are come to the full<WH8552>, a king<WH4428> of fierce<WH5794> countenance<WH6440>, and understanding<WH995> dark sentences<WH2420>, shall stand up<WH5975>. are: Heb. are accomplished

And his power<WH3581> shall be mighty<WH6105>, but not by his own power<WH3581>: and he shall destroy<WH7843> wonderfully<WH6381>, and shall prosper<WH6743>, and practise<WH6213>, and shall destroy<WH7843> the mighty<WH6099> and the holy<WH6918> people<WH5971>. holy: Heb. people of the holy ones

And through his policy<WH7922> also he shall cause craft<WH4820> to prosper<WH6743> in his hand<WH3027>; and he shall magnify<WH1431> himself in his heart<WH3824>, and by peace<WH7962> shall destroy<WH7843> many<WH7227>: he shall also stand up<WH5975> against the Prince<WH8269> of princes<WH8269>; but he shall be broken<WH7665> without<WH657> hand<WH3027>. peace: or, prosperity

And the vision<WH4758> of the evening<WH6153> and the morning<WH1242> which was told<WH559> is true<WH571>: wherefore shut thou up<WH5640> the vision<WH2377>; for it shall be for many<WH7227> days<WH3117>.

And I Daniel<WH1840> fainted<WH1961>, and was sick<WH2470> certain days<WH3117>; afterward I rose up<WH6965>, and did<WH6213> the king's<WH4428> business<WH4399>; and I was astonished<WH8074> at the vision<WH4758>, but none understood<WH995> it.
